p: In this study, for the first time, a solvent-free, fast, unselective, scalable extraction process was tested for its potential to produce aqueous solutions based on silver fir ( Abies alba Mill.) needles and boost the respective in vitro antioxidant activity. This process was based on controlled hydrodynamic cavitation (HC), an emerging technique with a short but successful history in the extraction of valuable biocompounds [ 17, 18, 19]. Beyond the resulting biologically relevant properties, the manufacturing process of the aqueous solutions is very important, in particular the respective scalability and cost, conditioning the overall feasibility, as well as the affordability of the final product.
